bookDescription: The third book in the Housemaid series. Dangers lurk in a quiet neighborhood.
Nantucket residents are alarmed when a home, recently sold at an exorbitant price, goes up in flames and someone goes missing.
A biotech engineer at a food science start-up has a secret affair with one of the business partners who took over the company.
The Big Island of Hawaii comes under threat by a volcano at the same time a secret held by the military comes to light.
In 1965, a nursing student follows her brother to serve during the Vietnam War and returns to a divided America.
The third book in the Camino series. The last living inhabitant of a deserted island gets in the way of a resort developer.

bookTitle: A COURT OF THORNS AND ROSES
bookDescription: After killing a wolf in the woods, Feyre is taken from her home and placed inside the world of the Fae.
Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.
A dozen short stories that explore darkness in literal and metaphorical forms.
After their exes run off together, Daphne and Miles form a friendship and concoct a plan involving misleading photos.

bookTitle: A COURT OF MIST AND FURY
bookDescription: The second book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. Feyre gains the powers of the High Fae and a greater evil emerges.
Lucy returns to Prince Edward Island, where she finds it difficult to stay away from her best friend’s younger brother.
Justin and Emma, whose exes find soulmates after breaking up with them, have a fling on a private island on Lake Minnetonka.
A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.
The second book in the Ruinous Love series. An indie musician offers a contract killer a way to his freedom, but only if he'll marry her.
The author of “The Splendid and the Vile” portrays the months between the election of Abraham Lincoln and the beginning of the Civil War.
The "Fox & Friends Weekend" host shares his experiences serving in the Army and his views on the current state of the American military.
A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.
The ABC host and former adviser to President Clinton describes the location where and conditions under which a dozen presidential administrations handled crises.
The actor and director mixes stories from his family with tales of celebrities.
The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.

bookDescription: The host of “Real Time With Bill Maher” gives his take on a variety of subjects in American culture and politics.
How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

The musician and filmmaker pulls together some of the creative and cultural forces behind hip-hop.

A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

bookTitle: THE WREN IN THE HOLLY LIBRARY
bookDescription: A thief breaks the Monster Treaty that was created in the aftermath of the destruction of New York City years ago.
An aspiring screenwriter hopes to convince a famous but jaded screenwriter that love stories matter.
A reimagining of “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn” shines a different light on Mark Twain's classic, revealing new facets of the character of Jim.
The second book in the Crowns of Nyaxia series. Oraya faces a difficult choice between love and power.
A Hollywood reboot of an art-house horror flick brings up decades-old, on-set tragedies for its sole surviving cast member.
Lawyers from different backgrounds represent a Black man charged with killing a wealthy white couple in Virginia in 1968.
The 24th book in the Dave Robicheaux series. Robicheaux and his partner Clete Purcel go after smugglers of a new drug.

A former couple pretend to be together for the sake of their friends during their annual getaway in Maine.
The first book in the Twisted series. Secrets emerge when Ava explores things with her brother’s best friend.

bookTitle: A COURT OF WINGS AND RUIN
bookDescription: The third book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. As war approaches, Feyre endeavors to take charge of her magical and political powers.
Anastasia might need the help of the captain of a college hockey team to get on the Olympic figure skating team.

bookTitle: A COURT OF FROST AND STARLIGHT
bookDescription: The fourth book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. After alterations incurred by war, Winter Solstice approaches.
How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.
The story of the American rowers who pursued gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympic Games; the basis of the film.
A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
A reassessment of events surrounding the murders committed by Charles Manson’s followers.
The British journalist shares stories and observations; the basis of the TV series.
A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the former host of “The Daily Show.”
The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
The author recalls how she and her siblings were constantly moved from one bleak place to another.
An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.
The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
A portrayal of the disappearance of Lauren Spierer.
Essays and drawings by the author of “The Joy Luck Club” and “The Bonesetter's Daughter,” which depict a search for peace through birding.

bookTitle: THE DEVIL IN THE WHITE CITY
bookDescription: A story of how an architect and a serial killer were linked by the Chicago World's Fair of 1893.
The former first lady shares personal stories and the tools she uses to deal with difficult situations.

bookTitle: THERE ARE DADS WAY WORSE THAN YOU

bookDescription: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)
Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)
The demigods Will and Nico embark on a dangerous journey to the Underworld to rescue an old friend. (Ages 10 to 14)
After a shark attack, Odder recuperates at the aquarium with the scientists who raised her. (Ages 8 to 12)
The friends Frank and Stanley give a vivid account of the Pearl Harbor attack. (Ages 8 to 12)
Olive is sent to Reforming Arts School and teams up with a group of crime-fighting outcasts. (Ages 8 to 12)

bookTitle: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
bookDescription: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)
Roswell is accidentally abducted by aliens and learns of a sinister plot against Earth. (Ages 8 to 12)
A pug named Sam protects his family. (Ages 8 to 12)

bookTitle: WINGS OF FIRE: A GUIDE TO THE DRAGON WORLD
bookDescription: A deeper dive into the legends of the 10 dragon tribes. (Ages 8 to 12)

bookTitle: WHY A DAUGHTER NEEDS A DAD
bookDescription: A father's love for his daughter. (Ages 4 to 8)

bookTitle: WHY A SON NEEDS A DAD
bookDescription: The bond between father and son. (Ages 4 to 7)

bookTitle: I LOVE DAD WITH THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
bookDescription: Celebrating dad with help from that insatiable insect. (Ages 3 to 5)
The Catch Club Kids attempt to snare the Daddysaurus, known for his acts of kindness and bravery. (Ages 4 to 8)

bookTitle: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
bookDescription: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)
Bingo wants to do a big girl sleep and wake up in her own bed. (Ages 4 to 8)
What to serve your dragon-guests. (Ages 3 to 5)

bookTitle: I LOVE GRANDPA WITH THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
bookDescription: The caterpillar shows love to granddad. (Ages 2 to 5)
A celebration of fatherhood. (Ages 4 to 7)
Willow's journey from a farm in Pennsylvania to the White House. (Ages 4 to 8)

bookTitle: A GOOD GIRL'S GUIDE TO MURDER
bookDescription: Pippa Fitz-Amobi solves murderous crimes. (Ages 14 and up)
In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)
The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

bookTitle: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
bookDescription: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)
A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)
The stories of Ivan, Bob and Ruby. (Ages 8 to 12)
A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)
Biographies unlock legendary lives. (Ages 8 to 11)
bookAuthor: Jim Gigliotti and others; various illustrators

bookDescription: In Ireland, friends at the private school Tommen College prepare for adulthood. (Ages 16 to 18)
Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)
Forbidden love is in the air when Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, become romantically involved. (Ages 14 and up)
Alessandra plots to kill the Shadow King and take his kingdom for herself. (Ages 13 to 18)
Adena is on her own in Loot, after Paedyn is selected for the Purging Trials. (Ages 14 and up)
Annabel Price's mother was presumed dead, until she reappears during the filming of a documentary about her disappearance. (Ages 14 to 17)
Two young rival journalists find love through a magical connection. (Ages 13 to 18)
In this sequel to "Lightlark," Isla must chose between her two powerful lovers. (Ages 13 and up)
In the sequel to "Divine Rivals," Roman and Iris will risk their hearts and futures to change the tides of the war. (Ages 13 to 18)
Murtagh and his dragon, Thorn, must find and outwit a mysterious witch. (Ages 12 to 15)
A young girl poses as a male on an online role playing game. (Ages 13 to 18)
Clementine would love to leave Calder Academy, the boarding school for rogue paranormals, but her mother, the headmaster, will not have it. (Ages 14 to 17)

bookTitle: I WILL TEACH YOU TO BE RICH, SECOND EDITION

bookDescription: The 12th book in the Dog Man series. Dog Man finds himself back on his hind legs after being sprayed by a skunk.
The appearance of a primal fear devil may make working together difficult for Asa and Yoru.
Hades and Persephone open up to each other but other relationships begin to disintegrate.

bookTitle: TWENTY THOUSAND FLEAS UNDER THE SEA
bookDescription: The 11th book in the Dog Man series. Piggy returns and the Supa Buddies are sabotaged.
The eighth book in the Baby-Sitters Little Sister series. A fight and an unfun new girl could sour a sleepover.
A cursed spirit threatens to put Maki and Noritoshi in danger.
The fifth book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. As publication seems possible, the baby frogs feel doubt.
The seventh book in the Wings of Fire graphic novel series. Winter must face his family in the Ice Kingdom.
The 15th book in the Baby-Sitters Club graphic novel series. Things escalate when a practical joker causes Claudia to break her leg.

bookTitle: THE LAST COMICS ON EARTH: TOO MANY VILLAINS!
bookDescription: As they make a sequel to their graphic novel, Jack, June, Quint and Dirk are shocked by what they learn about supervillains.
The fourth book in the Sweet Valley Twins graphic novel series. Troubles develop when a new girl moves into the town’s haunted house. Adapted by Nicole Andelfinger.
A swordsman teams up with the leader of a mercenary band to fight evil forces; collects the first three issues of the manga series.
The first book in the Wings of Fire graphic book series. Five dragonets spring into action to fulfill their destiny.
The seventh book in the Dog Man series. A new villain has a bone to pick with Dog Man while Petey the Cat starts a new life.
The 10th book in the Dog Man series. Can the power of love overcome the darkness and despair created by new villains?
Ballard and Bosch bury old resentments as they go after two killers.
The 22nd book in the Scot Harvath series. When American aid workers are killed amid other atrocities in Ukraine, America’s top spy is sent to set things right.
The 17th book in the Oregon Files series. Juan Cabrillo’s crew takes on a force of bio-hacked soldiers.
A nursing student and her widowed landlady navigate life changes and potential love interests.
A best-selling author inherits an estate near London from her uncle and contemplates embracing a new identity.
A private investigator named Pinky helps an attorney try to clear a female police chief of sexual misconduct charges made by three male officers.
The 15th book in the Private series. A murder in Moscow appears to be linked to one that happened inside the New York Stock Exchange.
Challenges arise when a young woman takes over her family’s haute couture Italian leather brand and 400-year-old palazzo in Venice.
After covering up for his brother and going to prison, John Bannack becomes a judge’s bodyguard.
bookAuthor: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone

bookDescription: The TV journalist Kerra Bailey and former federal agent John Trapper join forces to expose a web of conspiracy behind a hotel bombing in Dallas.
After his parents were killed during an ambush, a 15-year-old goes in search of his missing sisters.
bookAuthor: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone

bookDescription: Jess has suspicions about her half-brother’s eclectic and unfriendly neighbors when he goes missing.
Two childhood friends follow in their fathers’ footsteps, which puts them on opposite sides of the law.
Three romance stories: “Tiny Blessings,” by Fern Michaels, “Dogwood Season,” by Carolyn Brown and “Cowboy True,” by Stacey Finz.
The fourth book in the Bridgerton series. Penelope Featherington and Colin Bridgerton discover each other's secrets.

bookTitle: IF HE HAD BEEN WITH ME
IF ONLY I HAD TOLD HER
